boat.full_description:
Molly Cobbler's lines were drawn by naval architecht Paul Fisher as a result of a commission to produce an open gaff cutter based on a traditional Mevagissey Tosher fishing boat, but with a lifting keel and modern construction. The lines are very similar to those of a 1926 Tosher in the National maritime museum archive.

Paul Fisher's plans were modified by the owner to include a cabin and cruising accommodation for two. Building commenced in 1997 at Fabian Bush's yard in Rowhedge and Molly was launched at Downs Road, Maldon in April 2000.
boat.name: Molly Cobbler
boat.short_description: A modern interpretation of a 1920s Mevagissy Tosher.
